Methodologies
We are defining communication
in a broad sense to be the process of
interchange of thought and attitude.
We consider a communication meth¬
od to be any procedure or practice
which promotes the interchange of
thought and attitude. We classify a
communication methodology as a
systematized set of principles and
techniques by means of which a
method of communication or a re¬
search design for arriving at knowl¬
edge about communication or a com¬
munication event can be described,
evaluated, and implemented.
The committee has these func¬
tions: (1) To systematize the meth¬
ods commonly used in communica¬
tion and to relate them to accepted
methodologies; (2) To formulate a
methodology for examining research
methods in communication; and (3)
To aid in the development of meth¬
odologically designed research pro¬
jects in the several areas involving
communication.
—Seth Fessenden
Three More Training
Labs Are Scheduled
Three summer training laborator¬
ies in human relations in addition to
the six reported in the last News¬
letter have been scheduled for this
summer according to information
received from the National Training
Laboratories, Division of Adult Edu¬
cation, N.E.A.
Two summer work conferences
will be held at Columbia Teachers
College in New York City under the
direction of the Center for Improv¬
ing Group Procedures. The first on
“The Role of the Consultant” will be
from July 11 to 22, and the second
on “Improving Staff Relations” will
be from August 1 to 12.
The F ourth Annual Midwest
Workshop in Community Human
Relations will be held at the Univer¬
sity of Chicago from July 25 to
August 12. For information write to:
Mrs. Bettie Sarchet, University Col¬
lege, 19 So. LaSalle St., Chicago 3.
From August 14 to 27 the First
Annual Southwest Human Relations
Training Laboratory will be held at
the University of Texas. For in¬
formation write to the Department
of Psychology, University of Texas,
Austin.
Emmett Betts has resigned from
the directorship of the Reading
Clinic at Temple University to di¬
rect the Betts Reading Clinic, Haver-
ford, Pennsylvania, where he will
continue his clinical, consulting and
research activities.
